text:
Hi

I'm trying to use ant 1.4 with saxon (6.3).
When I get the tar.gz packaging and invoke ant with 

<somepath>/jakarta-ant-1.4/bin/ant all is well.

When I try the same with the ant command after installing the rpm I get a

Buildfile: build.xml

BUILD FAILED

The AElfred parser is a SAX2 XMLReader

I think the 1.3 ant rpms had the same problem.
creator: nicolas.mailhot@one2team.com

text:
The problem is in this line of /usr/bin/ant :

if [ "$CLASSPATH" != "" ] ; then
  LOCALCLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:$LOCALCLASSPATH
fi

It should be changed to 

if [ "$CLASSPATH" != "" ] ; then
  LOCALCLASSPATH=$LOCALCLASSPATH:$CLASSPATH
fi
since ant jars are obviously more important to ant than external ones
creator: nicolas.mailhot@one2team.com

text:
Fixed in RPM release 2.

Thanks for reporting it Nicolas :)

text:
The fix in the shell script (changing order of CLASSPATH and LOCALCLASSPATH) will
probably make you use crimson instead of AElfred - I'm not familiar with the rpms
myself, sorry.

The original problme "The AElfred parser is a SAX2 XMLReader" is not related to
the rpms at all, it is related to AElfred's interpretation of backwards
compatibility (between SAX2 and SAX1).

Starting with nightly build 2002-02-15 Ant and AElfred are supposed to work
together peacefully.
